Quando componi un messaggio, nella barra degli strumenti di formattazione, ci sono due quadrati colorati di solito uno bianco sullo sfondo ed uno nero in primo piano. Facendo click su questo quadrati puoi cambiare il colore dello sfondo e del testo. Questo per il singolo messaggio.

Se vuoi usare lo stesso schema in tutti i messaggi vai in Tasto menu > Impostazioni > Composizione Togli il segno di spunta da Usa i colori predefiniti del lettore Poi immediatamente sotto personalizza i colori in Colore del testo e Colore di sfondo

(le altre impostazioni che hai modificato riguardano la lettura dei messaggi ed è preferibile se le riporti ai valori predefiniti)

If they are stored as .eml files and your computer is set up to open .eml files using Thunderbird. Then you can read them using Thunderbird.

However, if you are thinking of changing provider and want to keep copies of emails, then create some folders in 'Local Folders' mail account and use 'right click on highlighted email and select 'Copy to' and choose relevant folder in 'Local Folders' mail account. Check you really have a full copy; you can read emails stored in 'Local Folders'.

Basically, you do not have to save emails as .eml files to a folder outside of Thunderbird if you are going to stop using that particular email address.

You can only modify a password via the webmail account accessed via a browser.

If you do not know password, then use the 'forgotten Pasword' link and follow instructions to get access to webmail account. Once you have reset/modified password, then you need to update the one stored in Thunderbird, assuming you do allow Thunderbird to store passwords.

In Thunderbird

  • Settings > Privacy & Security
  • scroll to 'Passwords' section
  • clickon 'Saved Passwords'
  • click on 'Show Passwords'
  • Select each relevant line there will one for incoming and one fior outgoing.
  • Right click on line and select 'Edit Password'
  • Completely clear contents and carefully type in the new password.
  • click on 'Close'

REstart Thunderbird.

content:
There is also the 'Density' option. This was introduced in the 102* versions. This alters the amount of space between items in lists. Via 'Menu Bar' toolbar

  • 'View' > 'Density' > select an option note 'Compact' has the least space.

OR Via the menu app icon

  • 'Density' option has three icons. Compact, Default. Relaxed. Select the one you prefer.

In addition there is also the matter of choosing a suitable font size. Via 'Menu Bar' toolbar

  • 'View' > 'Font Size' > click on desired option to increase or decrease current font size by one size. Repeat action if you require a greater increase/decrease.

OR Via the menu app icon

  • 'Font Size' - click on the - or + icons to increase/decrease font size.

content:
It would help if you could post an image explaining the problem.

I'm presuming you are talking about the 'Message List'. What view are you using ? To the right of the Quick Filter' option is a new icon which allows you to select one of the following:

  • Table view = standard list, one email per line with Column headers.
  • Cards view = a style where one email is displayed over a couple of lines and no column headers.

If you use 'Cards View' then it is better to use 'View' > 'Layout' > 'Vertical view' This layout may suit people with wide screens. In your case; small screen; it would be better to use 'Table view'.

The image on the right shows you are using a new supernova 115* version. There are two setting you can try.

Suggest you enable the Menu Bar as it will make life a lot easier. Menu app > View > Toolbars > select Menu Bar

Then increase the space between items: View > Density > select 'Default' or 'Relaxed'

You can also choose to increase the size of the font: View > Font Size > select 'Increase Font size' You may need to select this more than once to get desired size.
